article:
In 1957, Jane Goodall first met the famous anthropologist   Dr Louis Leakey, who later played an important role in her life. With the   _  of gaining
insight into humans' evolutionary   past, Dr Leakey   _  a pioneering long-term
field study on  _  chimps. Even though Jane had no formal  _  , her patience and determination to understand animals  _  him
to choose her for the study.  _  it was unusual for a woman
to work in the forest of Africa, going there  _  the
fulfillment   of her childhood dream. In the summer of 1960 she   _  in Tanzania  on Lake Tanganyika's eastern shore. This marked the   _  of the longest continuous field
study of animals in their  _  habitat . Five years   _  , she earned
a doctor's degree at Cambridge University and then  _  to
Tanzania to found the Gombe Stream Research Center. And in 1977, to provide
on-going  _  for chimp research, Dr Goodall  _  The
Jane Goodall Institute.
Today, she   _  most of
her time traveling around the world, giving lectures on her  _  at

"Chimps have given me so   _   .The long hours spent with them in the  _  have enriched my
life beyond measure. What I have learned from them has shaped my  _  of
